headline: Robert W. Baird Maintains a Buy Rating on Analog Devices (ADI) After Q2 Report
summary: On May 22, Tristan Gerra of Robert W. Baird maintained a Buy rating on Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ:ADI) with a price target of $250, after the company reported its fiscal second-quarter results for 2025. Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ:ADI) grew revenue by 22% year-over-year to $2.6 billion, whereas the adjusted EPS soared 32% year-over-year to $1.85. […]

headline: Why Analog Devices Stock Fell by More Than 4% Today
summary: Semiconductor company Analog Devices (NASDAQ: ADI) published its latest quarterly earnings report Thursday morning, but despite its estimates-beating performance, investors sold out of the stock.  For its fiscal second quarter of 2025, Analog Devices' revenue came in at $2.64 billion, 22% higher year over year.  In its earnings release, Analog Devices attributed the double-digit gains to both internal and external factors.

In its earnings release, Analog Devices attributed the double-digit gains to both internal and external factors.

headline: Analog Devices Stock Falls Despite Solid Earnings, Upbeat Outlook. Here’s Why.
summary: Shares of  Analog Devices  lost ground Thursday, reversing a surge that came as the semiconductor company posted earnings that topped Wall Street’s expectations and shared a rosy forecast for the current quarter.  Adjusted earnings for the fiscal second quarter came in at $1.85 a share beating the consensus call for $1.70 among analysts tracked by FactSet.  Analog Devices cited “double-digit year-over-year growth across all end markets.”

headline: Humana & UnitedHealth, Hinge Health IPO, Analog Devices sinks
summary: Catalysts host Madison Mills tracks today's top stories and stocks in this Market Minute. Humana (HUM) and UnitedHealth (UNH) stocks are sliding amid a Medicare crackdown. Digital health company Hinge Health (HNGE) debuts on the NYSE, opening at $39.25 per share — higher than the expected $28 to $32 range. Analog Devices (ADI) stock is under pressure after citing impacts from tariffs, despite beating second quarter earnings expectations. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Analog Devices CFO Confirms Cyclical Upturn, Sees 'Continued Growth'
summary: Analog Devices, Inc (NASDAQ:ADI) shares are trading higher in the premarket session on Thursday after the company reported fiscal second-quarter results. The company’s quarterly revenue increased 22% year-on-year to $2.64 billion, beating the analyst consensus estimate of $2.51 billion. Adjusted EPS of $1.85 beat the analyst consensus estimate of $1.70. Analog Devices’ Industrial revenue grew by 16.8% Y/Y to $1.16 billion. Automotive revenue climbed 24.2% Y/Y to $849.51 million. Also Read: China

headline: Analog Devices forecasts third-quarter results above estimates
summary: Analog Devices forecast third-quarter revenue and profit above Wall Street expectations on Thursday, betting on upbeat demand for its chips used in the automotive and industrial sectors. The Wilmington, Massachusetts-based chipmaker projected third-quarter revenue of $2.75 billion, plus or minus $100 million, above estimates of $2.62 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG. It also forecast adjusted per-share earnings of $1.92, plus or minus 10 cents, which was above Wall Street estimates of $1.83 per share.

It also forecast adjusted per-share earnings of $1.92, plus or minus 10 cents, which was above Wall Street estimates of $1.83 per share.

headline: Analog Devices: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 11 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.69 per share. The semiconductor maker posted revenue of $2.64 billion in the period, also surpassing Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $2.5 billion.

headline: Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI) Reports Strong Q1, Guides for Strong Sales Next Quarter
summary: Manufacturer of analog chips Analog Devices (NASDAQ:ADI) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 22.3% year on year to $2.64 billion. On top of that, next quarter’s revenue guidance ($2.75 billion at the midpoint) was surprisingly good and 4.5% above what analysts were expecting. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.85 per share was 9.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
